thread.title: ‘I Am Not Your Negro’ Brilliant Notes on a Native Son
thread.title_full: ‘I Am Not Your Negro’ Review: Brilliant Notes on a Native Son - WSJ

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘I Am Not Your Negro’ Brilliant Notes on a Native Son
text:
The only sign of punch-pulling in “I Am Not Your Negro,” Raoul Peck’s documentary portrait of the writer and social critic James Baldwin, is the last word of the title; that’s not the N-word Baldwin favored in his fiery denunciations of racism in America. Otherwise the film is unsparing as history and enthralling as biography. It’s an evocation of a passionate soul in a tumultuous era, a film that uses Baldwin’s spoken words, and his notes for an unfinished book, to illuminate the struggle for civil rights.
The book,...
